problem_text:
A subgroup H of a group G is called P-subnormal in G if either H = G, or there is a chain of subgroups H0 ⊂ H1 ⊂ · · · ⊂ Hn−1 ⊂ Hn = G such that |Hi : Hi−1| is a prime for all i = 1, . . . , n. Must a finite group be soluble if every Shmidt subgroup of it is P-subnormal?
A. F. Vasil’ev, T. I. Vasil’eva, V. N. Tyutyanov
answer: Yes, it must (V. N. Tyutyanov, Probl. Fiz. Mat. Tekhn., 2015, no. 1 (22), 88–91 (Russian)).
